description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4fitu","text":"This protocol tailors common qPCR methods for quantifying transcript abundance in S. rosetta. The protocol covers primer design, synthesis of ssDNA standards, and assembling the qPCR reaction. It builds upon the preferential lysis and cDNA synthesis protocols and links to relevant guides and calculators for ease of use.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":82,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

related_materials.name: Luna Universal qPCR Master Mix - 2,500 rxns

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1l4nj","text":"Search for your gene of interest here https://protists.ensembl.org/Salpingoeca_rosetta_gca_000188695/Info/Index ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":38,"length":73}],"data":{}},{"key":"a1ja8","text":"After opening the gene page, click the \"Sequence\" tab on the left-hand column to display the gene's exons. From there click download sequence and select \"cDNA\". Reference the exon sequences on this page as you design primers or manually annotate exons in the cDNA file downloaded. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"8708776A55B311EF8E730A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://protists.ensembl.org/Salpingoeca_rosetta_gca_000188695/Info/Index"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ct9ms","text":"To begin qPCR primer design, primers must span exon-exon junctions, which should be previously annotated from the step above. A good source on qPCR primer design can be found here https://www.bio-rad.com/en-us/applications-technologies/qpcr-assay-design-optimization?ID=LUSO7RIVK","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":180,"length":99}],"data":{}},{"key":"7q06i","text":"Generally, select 19-20 bp spanning an exon junction, with a GC content of 50-60% and a tm of 50-65°C. The final amplicon should be 75-200 bp, so pick your second primer accordingly, which should also span an exon junction. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5u5h1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7vldn","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4proc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9efoc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"051C631B55B511EF8E730A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.bio-rad.com/en-us/applications-technologies/qpcr-assay-design-optimization?ID=LUSO7RIVK"}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"brtbt","text":"If your qPCR is to test the effects of a KO mutation, you'll want the entirety of the amplicon to be downstream of the PTS insertion because transcription will likely read through until the PTS. If the amplicon is before the PTS insert, the qPCR will likely result in no or less of a decrease in expression.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8dvrv","text":"qPCR primers must span exon-exon junctions to avoid genomic DNA amplification. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9gbkk","text":"Amplification validation:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"be6v6","text":"Select your qPCR reaction mix (we used NEB luna qPCR master mix), and use cDNA (previously synthesized, protocols for preferential lysis, RNA extraction and cDNA synthesis) as template, test amplification in the qPCR master mix by following the manufacturer's protocols. Run the completed reaction on a 1% agarose gel and check that the amplicon is the expected size and that there is only one amplicon. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":118,"length":18},{"key":1,"offset":138,"length":33}],"data":{}},{"key":"8n5pa","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8jb6t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"BBE285EA364B4D2EB94E73B5B5C8E6E4","url":"https://www.protocols.io/edit/preferential-lysis-of-s-rosetta-for-total-rna-vers-bxg6pjze"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AABC488DB56D436987937A181842FED0","url":"https://www.protocols.io/edit/cdna-synthesis-for-cloning-version-1-b4qvqvw6"}},"2":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","guid":"4132D8AE341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"Luna Universal qPCR Master Mix - 2,500 rxns","pubchem_id":"0","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":"M3003E","stats":{"total_protocols":0},"url":"https://www.neb.com/M3003","vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/2.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.neb.com/","name":"New England Biolabs"}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c008d","text":"Amplification efficiency:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"co0t0","text":"To test the efficiency of amplification, you'll need to make a standard curve that as closely as possible matches your input material for the final qPCR reaction. In our case, this was ssDNA from cDNA synthesis.  Therefore, our standard curve was composed of ssDNA matching the template or antisense strand of our gene since that's the product of cDNA synthesis. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dgr30","text":"ssDNA standard synthesis:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4np3r","text":"ssDNA standards were generated from PCR products amplified from cDNA with a forward primer that was 5’ phosphorylated to promote Lambda exonuclease digestion of that strand and a reverse primer with phosphorothioate bonds between the first four 5’ nucleotides to block digestion. Those PCR products were then digested with Lambda exonuclease following NEB’s protocol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"447am","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f56bj","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1voo","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9p04m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","4_0":"","4_1":""},"colTitles":[],"colWidths":[],"data":[["\u003cstrong style=\"box-sizing: inherit; font-weight: 700;\"\u003eComponents\u003c/strong\u003e","\u003cstrong style=\"box-sizing: inherit; font-weight: 700;\"\u003e50\u0026nbsp;μl REACTION\u003c/strong\u003e"],["\u0026nbsp;DNA","\u0026nbsp;up to 5 μg"],["\u0026nbsp;Lambda Exonuclease Reaction Buffer (10X)","\u0026nbsp;5 μl (1X)"],["\u0026nbsp;Lambda Exonuclease","\u0026nbsp;1 μl (5 units)"],["\u0026nbsp;Nuclease-free H2O","\u0026nbsp;up to 50 μl"]],"rowHeights":[]}},"1":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":false,"cas_number":"","guid":"41023F32341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","linfor":"","mol_weight":0,"name":"Lambda Exonuclease - 1,000 units","pubchem_id":"0","public":1,"rrid":"","sku":"M0262S","stats":{"total_protocols":2},"url":"https://www.neb.com/M0262","vendor":{"id":0,"image":{"placeholder":null,"source":"/img/vendors/2.png"},"is_requested":false,"link":"https://www.neb.com/","name":"New England Biolabs"}}}}}

Qubit ssDNA Assay Kit by creating a standard curve with the provided standards (0 ng/μl and 20 ng/μl, making serial dilutions of the 20 ng/μl standard to generate the in-between concentrations).   of standards and digested ssDNA template were placed in a clear bottom 96 well plate and then measured for fluorescence (Ex = 500 nm / Em=540 nm) on a plate {"blocks":[{"key":"4ujhd","text":"Standard dilutions:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8jmfs","text":"Serially dilute the ssDNA standards from 105 to 100 copies/µl in a solution with 10 ng/µl of S. rosetta  total RNA (after removing mRNAs) to account for any matrix effects. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":43,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":50,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":93,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f1537","text":"Cover the plate with an optically clear cover and then cycle the reactions according to the manufacturer on a qPCR machine (We use an Applied Biosystems Quantstudio 3). Measure fluorescence in the FAM/SYBR Green Channel when using the NEB Luna qPCR Master Mix.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6c3pa","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"pjqd","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"28pvr","text":" *The melt curve step is optional but is useful to confirm that only a single target was amplified.
